name: autohide the menu & sidebar [The Washington Post]
description: Autohide the header, footer, and right sidebar. Reduces the clutter without removing content.
additional_info:
Header and footer are collapsed and represented with site icons in the upper-left and lower-left corners of the screen. The right sidebar is collapsed to a thin gray strip at the left edge of the screen. Mouse over the placeholder to restore the hidden content. This style is valid CSS 3. (Woohoo!) N.B.: I use AdBlock Plus. If this page looks busier in your browser than in the screenshot, that's probably why.
